subject: RE: [junit] Dogmatic or Heuristic?
msgSnippet: ... Also known as Shu or Level 1 audience: http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ShuHaRi http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ThreeLevelsOfAudience ... That s certainly a heuristic I like.
messageBody:
> The second question is perhaps more of a comment than a question. I
> think that when a novice asks us a question, it's OK for us to
> provide a simple, dogmatic-sounding answer. This person is learning,
> and is therefore not well-informed about the consequences of the
> choices he has in front of him.

Also known as Shu or Level 1 audience: http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ShuHaRi
http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ThreeLevelsOfAudience

> That said, perhaps we
> ought to ask more questions before giving answers....

That's certainly a heuristic I like. It's sometimes a little bit frustrating
to apply though, because people typically reply more positively to
solutions than to more questions. The solutions don't even have to be very
adequate... <sigh>

Regards, Ilja
